Releases

  • A new version (v0.1.0) of bikedata is on CRAN. See the release notes for details. Check out the bikedata vignette to get started. Repository on GitHub
  • A new version (v0.2.1) of stplanr is on CRAN. See the release notes for details. Check out the stplanr vignettes to get started. Repository on GitHub
  • A new version (v1.1.1) of GSODR is on CRAN. See the release notes for details. Check out the GSODR vignettes to get started. Repository on GitHub
  • A new version (v1.0.9) of lingtypology is on CRAN. See the release notes for details. Check out the lingtypology vignette to get started. Repository on GitHub
  • A new version (v1.6) of magick is on CRAN. See the release notes for details. Check out the magick vignette to get started. Repository on GitHub
  • A new version (v0.8.0) of rcrossref is on CRAN. See the release notes for details. Check out the rcrossref vignette to get started. Repository on GitHub
  • A new version (v0.1.0) of bomrang is on CRAN. See the NEWS file for details. Check out the bomrang vignettes to get started. Repository on GitHub



Software Review âœ”

We accept community contributed packages via our onboarding system - an open software review system, sorta like scholarly paper review, but way better. Weâ€™ll highlight newly onboarded packages here. A huge thanks to our reviewers, who do a lot of work reviewing (see the blog post on our review system), and the authors of the packages!

If you want to be a reviewer fill out this short form, and weâ€™ll ping you when thereâ€™s a submission that fits in your area of expertise.

The following packages were recently submitted for review:

  • Rnightlights > Satellite Nightlight Data Extraction
    • Author: Chris Njuguna
    • Issue: ropensci/onboarding#159
    • Reviewers: not assigned yet
  • weathercan > Download Weather Data from the Environment and Climate Change Canada Website
    • Author: Steffi LaZerte
    • Issue: ropensci/onboarding#160
    • Reviewers:
      • Joe Thorley

  • ijtiff > TIFF I/O for ImageJ Users
    • Author: Rory Nolan

On the blog

main blog

Weâ€™ve had four blog posts on our main blog in the past two weeks.

One of the posts is from our community manager Stefanie Butland: The Value of Welcome, part 2: How to prepare 40 new community members for an unconference. Read the related blog post (part 1, from earlier this year) on the blog.


Two posts come from the recent rOpenSci unconference #ozunconf in Melbourne, Australia.

In one piece Holly Kirk, Di Cook, Alicia Allan, Ross Gayler, Roger Peng, and Elle Saber summarized one of the projects at the unconf: ochRe - Australia themed colour palettes. Check out the project at ropenscilabs/ochRe.


In another #ozunconf piece AnikÃ³ TÃ³th and Nick Golding discuss their project changes: easy Git-based version control from R. Check out the project at ropenscilabs/changes.


Last, we had a post announcing a new software review collaboration: Announcing a New rOpenSci Software Review Collaboration.

Jeroen Ooms discusses v1.6 of the magick package: Magick 1.6: clipping, geometries, fonts, fuzz, and a bit of history

Keep up with rOpenSci

  • Mailing list: Sign up with an email address to get this newsletter sent to your inbox -> ropensci.org/#subscribe
  • Alternatively, you can subscribe to this newsletter via our XML feed at https://ropensci.github.io/biweekly/feed.xml or our JSON feed at https://ropensci.github.io/biweekly/feed.json
  • rOpenSci on Twitter: @ropensci
  • The rOpenSci blog at ropensci.org/blog - you can subscribe in any RSS aggregator, or manually via https://ropensci.org/feed.xml. We also announce new blog posts on our Twitter account.
